'''Kamal Abbas''' is General Coordinator of the [[Center for Trade Unions and Workers Services]] (CTUWS), an activist group for independent unions in Egypt.<ref>{{cite web|last=Dine |first=Philip |url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2011/feb/8/dine-egyptian-workers-key-element-in-uprising/ |title=DINE: Egyptian workers key element in uprising |publisher=Washington Times |date=2011-02-08 |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref> Involved in activism for over 20 years<ref name="towardfreedom1">{{cite web|url=http://www.towardfreedom.com/home/labor/2439-roots-of-egypts-revolution-labor-unions-and-the-uprising-in-tahrir-square |title=Roots of Egyptâs Revolution: Labor Unions and the Uprising in Tahrir Square |publisher=Towardfreedom.com |date=2011-06-22 |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref> Abbas has been active in mobilizing worker support during the [[Egyptian revolution of 2011]] and its aftermath. His approach emphasizes peaceful strikes and rallies accompanied by demands for better wages and working conditions.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/2011216141815340645.html |title=Egyptians defy call to end strikes - Middle East |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=2011-02-16 |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref>
+
'''Kamal Abbas''' ({{lang-ar|ÙÙØ§Ù Ø¹Ø¨Ø§Ø³}}) is General Coordinator of the [[Center for Trade Unions and Workers Services]] (CTUWS), an activist group for independent unions in Egypt.<ref>{{cite web|last=Dine |first=Philip |url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2011/feb/8/dine-egyptian-workers-key-element-in-uprising/ |title=DINE: Egyptian workers key element in uprising |publisher=Washington Times |date=2011-02-08 |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref> Involved in activism for over 20 years<ref name="towardfreedom1">{{cite web|url=http://www.towardfreedom.com/home/labor/2439-roots-of-egypts-revolution-labor-unions-and-the-uprising-in-tahrir-square |title=Roots of Egyptâs Revolution: Labor Unions and the Uprising in Tahrir Square |publisher=Towardfreedom.com |date=2011-06-22 |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref> Abbas has been active in mobilizing worker support during the [[Egyptian revolution of 2011]] and its aftermath. His approach emphasizes peaceful strikes and rallies accompanied by demands for better wages and working conditions.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/2011216141815340645.html |title=Egyptians defy call to end strikes - Middle East |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=2011-02-16 |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref>
